result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter to Clerk of Court from Atty. Birenbaum re: Motion to Modify Bond

11:26 AM Defendant Michael Ray McDonald appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Birenbaum appeared by phone for Michael Ray McDonald.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to in person appearance. Preliminary hearing waiver efiled, court reviewed w/defendant. State efiles the information, defense received, reading waived. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over. Defendant enters NG plea.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Atty. Birenbaum is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $25.00 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 02.01.2023.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

Atty. Birenbaum
